text: how is it that weird al yankovic has
managed to carve out a career more than
30 years in counting in the ephemeral
field novelty music partly by being
funny and partly by preparing for the
unpredictable undulations of the
zeitgeist
even when things don't go quite as
expected mr. Yankovic told me in an
interview he can still rely on the pop
culture Cuisinart that is his
overstimulated media-saturated brain on
jun 21st mr. Yankovic will release
alpaca lips his 13th full-length studio
album including parodies of taylor swift
and miley cyrus but it is the album's
lead off single performed this way a
parody of Lady Gaga's Born This Way that
has already garnered the most attention
largely because of mr. Yankovic's public
an uncharacteristically pointed response
when he was initially denied permission
to include it on alcoholic mr. Yankovic
says he seeks permission for his
parodies partly out of respect for his
fellow musicians partly to avoid
lawsuits and partly to work out royalty
arrangements the original artists retain
their publishing rights on the parodies
and mr. Yankovic splits songwriting
credit with them although his parodies
are likely protected under fair use
foolish they fall into a legal gray area
where copyright holders use lawsuits or
the threat of lawsuits to protect their
brands but after the song and the story
behind it bounced around the internet
for a day Lady Gaga's managers relented
lady gaga apparently approves of perform
this way in an interview with Rolling
Stone last month she told them that she
appreciated the philosophy behind the
song and found it very empowering this
way hey
the fungus performers way I'm really not
insane i just before this way
